bibl.title: Despatch from R. Dorsey Mohew to W.F. Wharton, Decemeber 23, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.ab:
Commercial Agency of the United States, Kongo Free State, Stanley Pool, Dec 20, 1892
Mr. R. Dorsey Mohew To the Department of State.
Subject: Rehuen to Pool from Kassai River
Abstract of Contents. Visit to Lake Leopold II + the LouKings River
div1.p:
Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State Washington, D.C.
Sir: I have the honor to inform you that I have just arrived here from the shead workers of the Loukenya River, and shall leave next week for the San Kouran + Kassai Riveer. The country any great distances back from the river backs it is hardly possible to see on account of the hostility of the natives, and noe that the Mauyema people (commonly called "arabs") have declared a general war against all whites traveling without a large escort is most dan- gerous.

was some 375 miles up the Loukenya slipping was a village called Maiyeaye. I desired to see the natives making clock + asked permission of the chief to visit the town, which was readily granted. I only looks six men with me armed with revolves war their whites. When I had gather about ten minutes dis- tance from the town. I was most- foully attackked from the bush with spears + poisoned arrows. Fortuantely none of my men were struck and before they could throw their arrows again we had opened fire + drove the natives ahead. We captured the villlage and I burned it to the ground to teach them a lesson. The next day the chief sent me some goats + desired to make blood brotherhood + declare peace which I was more than gland to grant This is only one of the five
or

or six times I have been compelled to fight during the past few months. If my report when sent to the De- partment does not seem to com- prehend the whole of the Kongo State, it will be because I have not enough of a force to penetrate to shore parts.

The whole Eastern boundary of the state is now shut by the Arabs and all the white men who were in the different ports have been killed. Their bodies were afterwords eaten by the large member of cannibal slaves attached to the caravans. So far my health has been good.
I am Sir: Very respectfully Your obident Servant R. Dorsey Mohew Commercial Agent
